sequence.reaction_type: Esterification (Silyl Ester Formation), Carboxylic Acid Protection
sequence.notes: The carboxylic acid group of Gabapentin is protected as a trimethylsilyl (TMS) ester using TMSCl and triethylamine (Et3N) in dichloromethane (CH2Cl2). The amine group remains untouched.

The primary amine undergoes carbamoylation with the chloroformate reagent, and the TMS ester is hydrolyzed to a carboxylic acid. Note: The drawn reagent (1-chloroethyl chloroformate) implies a 1-chloroethyl carbamate, but the drawn product shows an isopropyl carbamate. The provided SMILES for each component match their respective drawn structures in the screenshot.
Replacement of a chlorinated group with an isobutyryloxy group to form Gabapentin-Encarbil (Horizont), a prodrug.
